channel.title: Chells Background vs. Comic Book (Spoiliers)
channel.description: So in Portal 2 there is a potato science fair display with Chell's name on it. Looks like it was made by someone 10-12 and that was on the infamous BYDTWD. Now that suggest that not only did one of Chell's parents work at Aperture Science but she was there when everyone died. The comic "Lab Rat" shows Chell as an adult and that Ratman chose her be first choice to be un-thawed because of her "tenacity". I've read that the comic is considered for all intents and purposes cannon. Do you think Valve just put that name in the display to mess with us? Do you think cloning could explain this? Just curious.

item.title: Chells Background vs. Comic Book (Spoiliers)
item.dc:creator: Dr_Perky
item.description:
Chell is a test subject. I assume that they had some reserve of them (probably prisoners or something). They do allude to her being an Orphan which could mean she was “adopted” by Aperture for the sole purpose of testing. That’s just my take on it. I personally think they leave her so void of background so the players can fill in their own blanks. Having a whole set back-story is a bit boring for a character YOU are playing.

Read full topic

item.title: Chells Background vs. Comic Book (Spoiliers)
item.dc:creator: Disturbulator
item.description:
VALVe made Chell a vague character for the sole purpose of letting the community put together their own theories and ideas about her background.
This makes it more fun and intreguing to play.

By the looks of this thread, I’d say VALVe did well.

Read full topic

item.title: Chells Background vs. Comic Book (Spoiliers)
item.dc:creator: Nintyuk
item.description:
Although the Potato experiment that Chell works on mentions growth serums that she got off Daddy to use on her potato, hence the gigantic mega potato growing out of her display. What if she got contaminated with said growth serum, could explain said age discrepancy’s she could be a stubborn 15/16 year old with a 20 year old body. She gives every one the silent treatment because she’s moody and doesn’t give a fuck.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: mouserider
item.description:
danielsangeo:

Agreed. Chell is most obviously Gordon’s mother.

Didn’t we all agree that she’s Eli’s grandpa? Being a tranny, it all makes sense…

Remember when we discussed that on BYDTWD she was actually a 50 year old man suffering from a rare hormone disorder dresse[COLOR=‘Silver’]d as a lit[COLOR=‘DimGray’]tle girl[/SIZE][COLOR=‘DimGray’]…

Agreed. Chell is most obviously Gordon’s mother.

[COLOR=‘Black’]“Alright, this next test may involve trace amounts of time travel. So word of advice: if you meet yourself on the testing track, don’t make eye contact. Lab boys tell me that’ll wipe out time - entirely. Forward and backward. So do both of yourselves a favor and let that handsome devil go about his business.”

item.title: Chells Background vs. Comic Book (Spoiliers)
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
GLaDOS says that Chell has no parents. Then she said that Chell’s parents don’t want her anymore, trying to “call” her parents and getting that suspiciously worded “voice mail” recording.

And Wheatley is…well, Wheatley.

Read full topic

item.title: Chells Background vs. Comic Book (Spoiliers)
item.dc:creator: gaffers1996
item.description:
don’t forget though, GLaDOS talks to Chell in Portal 1 about BYDTWD coming up, and seeing as Chell has no parents, how could that possibly be her as a 10-12 year old in the potato battery competition, as she is testing, and then put back into sleep after she kills GLaDOS, so that isn’t really possible, also, wheatley didn’t do any scans, he just said that sometimes people experience brain damage, how do we know that Chell isn’t one of the lucky ones, and didn’t actually get brain damage, maybe she just doesn’t speak?

Read full topic

item.title: Chells Background vs. Comic Book (Spoiliers)
item.dc:creator: Eye_con
item.description:
One of the properies of moon dust… is that apparently its more “square” or less rounded anyways than regular sand. It’s pretty much the same as regular sand/dust, but because it hasn’t been tectonic movement, water erosion and such its able to hold its shape a little better… its true… I seen it on myth busters lol!

PS Where is said Comic I keep hearing about… I’m participating in a conversation in which I have no real idea what this comic is all about

Read full topic

I think it’s just that it works the best with moon dust, not that it doesn’t work on other surfaces.
